1.title: I, the Vampire
1.plot: A Hollywood director begins to suspect that the studio's new star might not just be playing a vampire- and that his own daughter is to be the next victim. Adapted from the short story by Henry Kuttner.

2.title: The First Snowfall of Winter
2.plot: The crew of a listening post on Pluto pick up a mysterious object heading into the center of the solar system- and after its passing, receive no more word from any other humans, anywhere.

3.title: Grotesquerie
3.plot: A lonely, disfigured woman is courted and swindled by a heartless suitor, but her vengeance upon him is beyond all imagining. Adapted from the short story by Harold Lawlor.

4.title: Risus Sardonicus
4.plot: A student stops by a local mortuary for a tour, but just what it is that she's trying to learn about is open to debate.

5.title: No Woman Born
5.plot: After being killed in a fire, an actress finds her brain transplanted into a shining golden robotic body- but will she be able to retain any semblance of her humanity? Adapted from the short story by C.L. Moore.

6.title: A Pound of Feathers
6.plot: Which one is more likely to kill you: a pound of feathers or a pound of lead? In this case, either is liable to be fatal.

7.title: Past Tense
7.plot: An inventor uses his time machine to bring penicillin to the world decades before its discovery, but will his efforts bear fruit? Adapted from the teleplay by Jack Weinstock and Willie Gilbert.

8.title: Things You Can't See
8.plot: When a beloved pet cat dies, her owners try different ways to deal with the passing- but then make a most unexpected, unbelievable discovery.

9.title: The Dancers
9.plot: Refugees from a dead Earth arrive on their new home world, only to find that a mystery they thought had been left behind has come along. Adapted from the short story by Wilton Hazzard.

10.title: Wish Upon a Star
10.plot: There's nothing as serene as a desert sunset, right? Of course, it depends entirely on the circumstances.

11.title: A Gun for Dinosaur
11.plot: Big-game hunting in the Mesozoic requires some very serious firepower- but what if that firepower was to fall into the wrong hands? Inspired by the short story by L. Sprague de Camp.

12.title: Episode #5.12
12.plot: A troubled young woman is admitted to a mental health facility- but will the path to finding peace within herself cost her the life of her eccentric new friend?

13.title: Episode #5.13
13.plot: A pair of classic short stories featuring two actresses. 'The Floor Above', adapted from the short story by M. Humphreys, concerns a woman who goes to visit a friend long thought to be dead- but finds that the truth is rather more complicated. 'The Picture in the House', adapted from the short story by H.P. Lovecraft, tells the tale of a traveler who ventures into a seemingly-deserted old house to escape a storm- only to learn that the storm may be preferable.

14.title: Episode #5.14
14.plot: On the anniversary of Harry Houdini's death, a phony supernatural investigator is challenged to spend the night in the 'Haunted House of the World'.

15.title: Episode #5.15
15.plot: A poet decides to flee the world and make her home in a department store, only to find that the store has an entire colony of like-minded folk- including a fragile young woman whom she befriends. Adapted from the short story by John Collier.

16.title: Episode #5.16
16.plot: A shady audio engineer designs a pair of headphones that not only isolate vocals like no other, but also pick up something deep beneath- peoples' thoughts.

17.title: Episode #5.17
17.plot: While visiting her childhood home, a reporter decides to do a story on the local railroad signalman- who seems to be haunted by a unknown specter. Adapted from the short story by Charles Dickens.

18.title: Episode #5.18
18.plot: No sooner do a detective and his identical triplet brothers settle in a new town then a series of murders begins- and the detective's prime suspect is close to home.

19.title: Episode #5.19
19.plot: A professional soldier is bet $1,000 that he can't spend one night in a haunted house...but is there more to this bet than meets the eye? Adapted from the short story by Bryan Lewis.

1.title: Cool Air
1.plot: A struggling young writer develops a friendship with a Spanish physician with a most curious ailment- an aversion to heat... Adapted from the short story by H.P. Lovecraft.

2.title: The Pipes of Tcho Ktlan
2.plot: A two-timing, larcenous 1940's swing band leader steals a forbidden Far East melody and uses it as the basis for a hit song- only to find out too late just why it is forbidden.

3.title: The Return of the Sorcerer
3.plot: A scholar is hired by a practitioner of the dark arts to decipher a very special passage from the dread Necronomicon - Adapted from the short story by Clark Ashton Smith.

4.title: Proof in the Pudding
4.plot: When an all-too-perfect newcomer to a small town enters the local cooking contest, her rivals become suspicious about her entry- specifically, what might be in it.

5.title: The Devil's Saint
5.plot: Eager to marry the niece of a Hungarian count, a young man agrees to sleep in a room that was once the scene of a murder - Adapted from the short story by John Dickson Carr.

6.title: Gag Reflex
6.plot: A pair of Borscht Belt comics find themselves kidnapped by extraterrestrials and forced into competition in an arena. At stake: their lives- and those of the entire human race.

7.title: The Graveyard Rats
7.plot: A pair of New England bodysnatchers are determined to obtain a corpse- no matter where they have to go in their pursuit - Adapted from the short story by Henry Kuttner.

8.title: An Ungentle Wager
8.plot: When rival soap opera actresses come into conflict over a role, they decide to settle their long-standing feud with a bet involving a substantial check- and a very sharp axe.

9.title: The Fire of Asshurbanipal
9.plot: Two soldiers-of-fortune, marooned deep in the desert, stumble across a city of legend- and the unspeakable, ancient evil it houses... Adapted from the short story by Robert E. Howard.

10.title: The Walls Between Us
10.plot: A lovely but haunted woman picks up an unsuspecting man in a bar, then drugs and kidnaps him. What she has planned is revenge, served up cold as the grave...

11.title: The Horla
11.plot: A Frenchman believes that his very life is being destroyed by an invisible being that stalks him. But is it all in his mind?... Adapted from the short story by Guy de Maupassant.

12.title: Essence
12.plot: The dysfunctional family of an elderly perfume mogul gathers at her deathbed. But little do they know just how far she is willing to go in order to protect her legacy- even from her own children...

13.title: The Hounds of Tindalos
13.plot: A researcher uses a mystical drug to travel backwards in time. But what he finds there is a horror beyond imagining... Adapted from the short story by Frank Belknap Long.

14.title: Madeline's Veil
14.plot: A grieving torch singer returns to the nightclub where she once worked, wearing a mourning veil as she waits night after night for the return of her low-life mobster lover...

15.title: Wet Saturday
15.plot: On a rainy Saturday afternoon, a proper English family finds itself debating what to do with an uninvited guest on the sunporch... Adapted from the short story by John Collier.

16.title: Forest of the Dark Unbound
16.plot: Two bank tellers, on the lam for theft and an accidental homicide, flee to the wilds of upper New York state, en route to Canada and freedom. But they aren't the only creatures stalking those woods...

17.title: Who Goes There?
17.plot: An Antarctic research expedition finds something frozen deep in the ice cap- something that is still alive... Adapted from the short story by John W. Campbell.

18.title: De Vermis Manorum
18.plot: Young honeymooners take refuge from a storm in a decaying Southern mansion. But the inhabitants, behind their congeniality, appear to be harboring a dark secret...

19.title: The Night Reveals
19.plot: An insurance investigator dealing with a rash of fires in Manhattan begins to suspect that the pyromaniac is his own wife... Adapted from the short story by Cornell Woolrich.

20.title: Ebb Tide
20.plot: An aging guitar legend, dying and wracked with guilt over the suicide of his devoted wife, challenges Satan to cut heads- with his own soul as the stakes...

21.title: Far Below
21.plot: The subway tunnels beneath New York City are home to a special police squad- and the cosmic horror it protects humanity from... Adapted from the short story by Robert Barbour Johnson.

22.title: Behind Every Great Man...
22.plot: When a nebbish volunteers to test a fully computerized home, he soon finds that it is willing to assist with every facet of his life- though sometimes just a bit too literally...

23.title: Pigeons from Hell
23.plot: Two brothers dare to spend the night in an abandoned Southern mansion that lays under a hideous curse... Adapted from the short story by Robert E. Howard.

24.title: Red Rook, White King... Black Cat
24.plot: A priceless pair of emeralds are the key to warming U.S./Hungarian relations during the Cold War, but cat burglar/burlesque star Kitty Divine has them in her sights...

25.title: The House in Cypress Canyon
25.plot: Newlyweds rent a house in the hills above Hollywood, only to find that it has a closet that cannot be opened- at least, not from the outside... Adapted from the radio play by Robert L. Richards.

26.title: Girl in the Snow
26.plot: A down-and-out prostitute is given the choice of either kill or be killed- a choice that becomes all the more difficult when she learns that her intended victim is her father...

1.title: The Dead Man
1.plot: An experiment using hypnotic suggestion to test the limits of human life goes horribly awry- and the worst is yet to come... Adapted from the short story by Fritz Leiber, Jr.

2.title: An Assignation at Poenari
2.plot: Courageous vampire hunters Abraham Van Helsing and Jonathan Harker return to Transylvania in order to deal with one final menace- the last, and most dangerous, of Dracula's wives...

3.title: Casting the Runes
3.plot: While looking into the death of a colleague, a researcher finds himself cursed by the head of a demonic cult... Adapted from the short story by M.R. James.

4.title: Testament
4.plot: When a Unified Earth exploration vessel finds itself marooned on an alien world, the crew finds itself at odds over what to do in order to survive until a rescue mission arrives...

5.title: The Impulse
5.plot: Though the police foil the plans of a mad bomber, he manages to plant his bomb in the bag of an unsuspecting woman- and it goes off at midnight... Adapted from the novella by John D. MacDonald.

6.title: Man of Tomorrow
6.plot: A man is able to see twenty-four hours into the future, but soon learns that even the best of intentions can lead to the direst of consequences- and can attract most unwanted attentions...

7.title: August Heat
7.plot: During an oppressive heat wave, two strangers have a premonition involving one another- and possibly a case of murder... Adapted from the short story by W.F. Harvey.

8.title: The Perfect Accessory
8.plot: When a shady character suspected of human trafficking goes missing, two detectives take up the search- only to learn that sometimes, the best place to hide is in plain sight...

9.title: The Corpse & the Kid
9.plot: After his beloved father murders his philandering wife, a young man is determined to make sure he pins the death on her boyfriend... Adapted from the short story by Cornell Woolrich.

10.title: Jinx of the Jellicoe Jasper
10.plot: World-famous cat burglar Kitty Divine steals a cursed painting in a fit of pique, only to learn that the only way to break the curse is to get someone to steal the painting from her...

11.title: Don't Look Now
11.plot: Two strangers in a bar get into a most bizarre conversation that focuses on the secret true rulers of Earth- the Martians... Adapted from the short story by Henry Kuttner.

12.title: That Which Has a Name
12.plot: Boston mobsters learn of a series of tunnels underneath the city that they hope to use for running contraband- but an ancient Basque legend may stand in the way.

13.title: Nyarlathotep
13.plot: City after city is falling into chaos, and a group of occult researchers could be the key to stopping it- or making a bad situation catastrophic... Adapted from the short story by H.P. Lovecraft.

14.title: 'I, Assassin'
14.plot: A hired killer with a conscience finds herself being hunted by a rival- and then the two of them are forced to work together against a common enemy...

15.title: The Black Madonna
15.plot: When his wealthy aunt dies after buying a painting that predicts the death of its owner, a man finds out that her death wasn't an accident... Adapted from the short story by Harold Lawlor.

16.title: Lilacs
16.plot: While visiting her aunt on the Jersey shore, a young girl finds herself inexplicably drawn to a thicket of lilacs- and what they're growing over...

17.title: Fury and Sound
17.plot: When a radio whiz kid becomes absolutely unbearable, his assistant concocts a plot to make him think that his hearing has become hypersensitive... Adapted for SUSPENSE from the short story by Roby Wentz.

18.title: The Shade of Rawalpindi
18.plot: The children of a deceased colonel in Victorian India determine to hunt down his murderer- but that murderer could be, quite literally, anybody...

19.title: Markesan
19.plot: While caretaking a remote coastal Maine estate, a young couple finds that the abandoned home down the hill isn't quite as abandoned as it should be.

20.title: This World's Not Big Enough...
20.plot: While dueling with an older, more mature rival, a mad scientist finds that the two of them have much more in common than either of them realized.

21.title: Boomerang
21.plot: Scheming to do away with the husband of his beloved, a Borneo plantation owner concocts a hideous plot involving the tiniest of insects.

22.title: And When She Was Bad...
22.plot: Burlesque star/cat burglar Kitty Divine finds herself dealing with a challenger on both fronts- a challenger who knows her dual identity,

23.title: Man from the South
23.plot: Down on his luck and stranded in Las Vegas, a young gambler agrees to bet with a strange foreign man- with his left pinkie finger as the stakes.

24.title: Lifeline
24.plot: When a starliner suffers a catastrophic accident, the two survivors find themselves running low on oxygen, drifting away from each other, and losing all hope of rescue.

25.title: Pledged to the Dead
25.plot: When a visitor to New Orleans inadvertently finds himself betrothed to a girl long-deceased, he must either keep his word or suffer a hideous death. Adapted from the short story by Seabury Quinn.

26.title: The Interrogator
26.plot: An alien visitor turns himself over to U.S. authorities, who call in their best interrogator. However, it soon becomes unclear as to who is questioning whom.

1.title: The Shadow on the Screen
1.plot: Invited to the home of a reclusive peer to view his 'forbidden film', a director is horrified at just how realistic the monstrosities she views are. Adapted from the short story by Henry Kuttner.

2.title: But Be the Serpent
2.plot: Two women, being victimized by an unscrupulous blackmailer, decide to murder him- but are they really working together, or is he onto them?

3.title: The Horror from the Mound
3.plot: Noticing that their neighbor carefully avoids one spot on their property, two ranchers sets out to discover why- but what they find is something not of this earth - Adapted from the short story by Robert E. Howard.

4.title: The Peacemakers
4.plot: Two scientists use an experimental time machine to stop an alien invasion, this is a case where the cure is worse than the disease.

5.title: Black
5.plot: A mystery man comes into a Midwestern town and finds himself embroiled in a family mob war- but does he have a hidden agenda? Adapted from the short story by Paul Cain.

6.title: The Smallest Mercy
6.plot: A woman keeps meeting the same man in her dreams, only to have him die over and over again in front of her eyes. But is it really a dream?.

7.title: De Mortuis
7.plot: When local busybodies catch their friend filling in a hole in her basement, they begin to wonder as to the whereabouts of her philandering husband.

8.title: Duel of the Double-Crosses
8.plot: When cat burglar extraordinaire Kitty Divine's favorite fence is strong-armed by some hoods, she sets out to free him from their grasp- only to walk into a trap.

9.title: The Moon Is Green
9.plot: With the surface of the earth destroyed by nuclear war, a lonely wife who yearns for beauty receives a most unexpected visitor at her window - Adapted from the short story by Fritz Leiber, Jr.

10.title: The Party Broke Up
10.plot: A beat cop stumbles across one dead body after another, and the common denominator is a most unlikely young woman.

11.title: 'Fugue in C-Minor'
11.plot: Not long after her marriage to a rich widower, a woman begins to suspect that her new husband may in fact have killed his previous wife. Adapted from the radio play by Lucille Fletcher.

12.title: 'On the Road to Somewhere'
12.plot: While trying to decide on her course of action, a young runaway wanders into a sleepy diner that doesn't seem to have any customers.

13.title: 'The Return of the Moresbys'
13.plot: When his heiress wife decides to leave her fortune to someone else, a gold-digger murders her- but will she get revenge in a most unexpected form? Adapted from the radio play by Henry Slesar,

14.title: 'I Am Not Part of This World'
14.plot: Released from alcoholic rehab, a commercial director begins drinking again when her husband and daughter return- from the grave.

15.title: 'A Child Is Crying'
15.plot: A unnaturally intelligent child is taken to a nuclear development facility to work for the U.S. military, but she has her own purposes for being there. Adapted from the teleplay by John D. MacDonald.

16.title: 'The Vanquished, the Accused'
16.plot: In the final days of World War 2, Allied General Dwight Eisenhower requests a meeting with Reichsmarshal Hermann Goering in order to understand the true nature of Nazism.

17.title: 'Feast of the Furies'
17.plot: Three sisters spend a fall evening together involving a wide series of accusations, a pier piling- and some rope. Suggested by the radio play by David Gillespie.

18.title: To the Farthest Shore
18.plot: On his 100th birthday, a gentleman answers the question of how he's remained so vigorous by telling his family a tale from Chinese mythology.

19.title: The Hangman Won't Wait
19.plot: A forensic scientist, discovering evidence that a woman sentenced to death that very night is innocent, must race against time to stop the execution- and catch the killer. Adapted from the short story by John Dickson Carr,

20.title: Learning Curve
20.plot: Intercepted by a damaged robotic 'doomsday machine', a lawman and his criminal charge will need to work together to escape- but may be unable to do either. Inspired by the writings of Fred Saberhagen.

21.title: The Night Ocean
21.plot: While vacationing at a remote cottage, an artist sees strange shapes in the ocean at night- shapes that may be related to a series of disappearances. Adapted from the short story by H.P. Lovecraft and R.H. Barlow.

22.title: Do You Remember When?
22.plot: An old-time child radio star begins listening to the transcription disks of his old shows, only to find that there are certain discrepancies between them and the historical record.

23.title: Death Sits in the Dentist's Chair
23.plot: A mother and daughter make an emergency visit to the dentist, but soon come to suspect that the man treating them is, in fact, an escaped murderer.

24.title: 'Dept. 96'
24.plot: A fledgling public defender finds herself assigned to a department of the Los Angeles court system that most people don't even know exists...and for good reason.

25.title: 'Catch You on the Flip Side'
25.plot: An unscrupulous disc jockey, on the run from trouble, takes a job at a station in the middle of nowhere- but her enemies all seem to find her anyway.

26.title: 'Keepers of the Twilight'
26.plot: Women from three generations of the Kirk family gather for a relaxing lakeside retreat, full of love and laughter- but it will be the last for one of them.

1.title: Logoda's Heads
1.plot: A young Englishwoman is in search of her brother, who has gone missing in the Ivory Coast- and a powerful witch doctor is the prime suspect. Adapted from the short story by August Derleth.

2.title: Indomitable the Magnificent
2.plot: When an aspiring animator stumbles upon a miraculous computer program, he creates the ultimate superhero- but what good is a hero without a villain?

3.title: The Crystal Egg
3.plot: What at first glance appears to be a commonplace piece of crystal turns out to be a window to an alien world- but a window that allows vision in both directions - Adapted from the short story by H.G. Wells.

4.title: Mukwonago
4.plot: An unhappy teen and her mother move to a sleepy Wisconsin town, but they soon learn that the town has a dark secret.

5.title: One Man's Poison
5.plot: Two uranium miners run out of provisions and desperately set down on an alien world, where they find a packed food warehouse- but nothing to eat. Adapted from the short story by Robert Sheckley.

6.title: Muscle
6.plot: Driving through the night in a vintage Dodge Superbee, two sisters are on the run to the U.S. Marshals- and away from the scene of a murder.

7.title: Trouble-Chaser
7.plot: Black, the 'Trouble Chaser', refuses to get involved in a Hollywood blackmail plot- only to be implicated in a pair of related murders. Adapted from the short story by Paul Cain.

8.title: All That Glitters
8.plot: A trio of lady prospectors searching for gold find a strange meteor instead- one that provides them with a most unwelcome surprise the next morning.

9.title: A Misfortune in Pearls
9.plot: When a highly valuable set of pearls goes missing in the mail, the most likely suspect is also the one who has the best alibi. Adapted from the radio play by Antony Ellis.

10.title: Operation Kickstand
10.plot: The Terran Colonial Service wants to enter into a trade pact with a newly discovered alien race...but how do you trade with aliens who don't want anything?

11.title: What You Need
11.plot: A curio shop owner possesses a means of predicting exactly what a customer will need, but an unscrupulous writer is determined to have that means all to himself.

12.plot: A teen with a lot on her mind can't sleep, but fortunately she has a best friend who's always right there for her.

13.title: The Damned Thing
13.plot: A local coroner calls an inquest into the death of a recluse, but the evidence points towards a cause of death beyond imagination. Adapted from the short story by Ambrose Bierce.

14.title: A Very Suspense-ful Christmas
14.plot: A trio of stories, all centered on a holiday theme. Segment #1, 'It's Beginning to Look Like Dagon', concerns three friends who decide to spend Christmas on a south Pacific Island, only to find themselves somewhere else altogether. Segment #2, 'Have a Hacking, Whacking Christmas', involves an office Secret Santa gift exchange that threatens to go very, very wrong. Segment #3, 'Hark the Deathly Angel Sing', follows the story of a family that receives a very unexpected- and very unwelcome- visitor on Christmas Eve.

15.title: White Rabbits
15.plot: A newlywed develops an interest in the lady across the breezeway from her, and in her beautiful pet rabbit. But neither the lady nor the rabbit are what they appear to be. Adapted from the short story by Leonora Carrington.

16.title: Watch That First Step
16.plot: Treacherous cousins hatch a scheme to do away with their wealthy, eccentric aunt, but the dowager proves far more difficult to murder than they expected.

17.title: In the Court of the Dragon
17.plot: Tourists buy and read one of the rarest- and most cursed- books in existence, only to soon develop the very disconcerting feeling that they're being followed. Adapted from the short story by Robert W. Chambers.

18.title: And the Sky Has Taken Him
18.plot: Air traffic controllers at a lonely Long Island airstrip receive a distress signal from a Scottish flyer- and a most unusual visitor who answers it.

19.title: The Hitch-Hiker
19.plot: A young man, driving from New York to Los Angeles, is dogged by a hitch-hiker who always seems to be ahead of him on the road. Adapted from the radio play by Lucille Fletcher.

20.title: A Night in the Life
20.plot: Burlesque star/cat burglar Kitty Divine sets her sights on the Pringle family jewels, but it seems as if all of Manhattan is conspiring against her.

21.title: The Red Lodge
21.plot: A young married couple rent a lovely house in the English countryside, only to find that it is already occupied- by something not of this world. Adapted from the short story by H.R. Wakefield.

22.title: Pioneer
22.plot: A future soldier, haunted by the vision of her long-destroyed hometown, devises a most unlikely plan to return to it.

23.title: Junkyard
23.plot: A survey vessel finds itself stranded on an alien world because something is stealing the crew's knowledge, bit by bit. Adapted from the radio play by Clifford D. Simak.

24.title: Duet
24.plot: After overhearing her boss making a big drug deal, a nightclub singer's only chance of salvation is a mysterious woman- but is she just death in another form?

25.title: The Space-Eaters
25.plot: As three writers of weird fiction spend an evening discussing their craft, they find themselves presented with a real-life horror beyond even their imaginations. Adapted from the short story by Frank Belknap Long. Special thanks to the Estate of Frank Belknap Long.

26.title: The Voice of the World
26.plot: In the aftermath of nuclear war, a radio engineer gets his old station back on the air, but wonders if there's anyone left to hear him.

-1.title: Death Wish
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.title: Suspense
plot: Revival of the classic 1940s-1950s television and radio anthology series, with different stories of mystery and the macabre every week.
